Необычная подача блюд, приятная музыка, ощущение простора.
189: Review: We were nearby and went looking for food. This place looked very busy and so we decided to pop inIt hands down has 1 of the best looking staff I have EVER seen in a restaurant. Like it must be part of the job descriptionThere were meats hanging up which is a bit off-putting if you are not a non-meat eater but the menu had a cheesy pizza and cheesy it was! I am not a believer in you can have too much cheese, but this is the closest I have come to it! I was a decent size and the menu was decently pricedI haven't been back to the area since but saw this is a chain and so I will definitely go to 1 of the others
190: Review: Io e il mio ragazzo abbiamo prenotato sotto consiglio di un'amica. Tutto delizioso uno dei pochi posti a Londra dove puoi veramente mangiare bene e sentirti vicino all'Italia. Sicuramente ci torneremo!! E il conto era più che onesto!!
191: Review: Sicuramente simpatici, carne morbida ma senza sapore..,, altro che spacciarla per fassona!!!!! Ma a londra ci può stare..... ma che per 1 tartare di 7 cm di diametro, una costata non fiorentina da 760 gr. 51,50 sterline, un polletto , un'acqua , senza bottiglia di vino ed una birretta. Praticamente 100 sterline ovvero 120€.... non cascateci andate piuttosto a firenze a mangiare carne buona e saporita....
192: Title: Lovely night and amazing steak

Review: I went to visit this location after the famous South Kensington and.. I really loved Union Street! The restaurant has a wonderful atmosphere.. The steak was amazing and the starters that the staff suggested too. The service was accurate and professional and the staff was knowledgeable and really friendly. We had a great time and a lovely dinner! Thank you guys we'll be back soon!
193: Review: Ispirati dalla trasmissione italiana 4 RISTORANTI, il mio lui prenota un tavolo presso il ristorante di Union Street. Il locale è caratterizzato da un bel format: passerella centrale che divide e unisce il socia table, cella frigorifera a vista e, ciò che è ancor più interessante, è l’angolo macelleria in bella vista al centro del locale e l’angolo cottura al suo lato.Il cibo ha soddisfatto le nostre aspettative! Antipasto di battuta e focaccia al formaggio, con a seguire una steak con pere e sale grosso per me e un bel filetto per il mio lui, il tutto contornato con delle deliziose patate al forno.Niente dolce, ma caffè: quello italiano!Lo staff, composto in predominanza da italiani, è cortese e gentile.Ristorante da provare in preda a un raptus di nostalgia di casa e a una voglia pazza di buona carne!
194: Review: I have recently visited this place. It was not my choice of the restaurant and would not be. As a non meat eater I found this place is very limited on vegeterian options. Service was ok. Pizza actually tasted good.
195: Review: Ottima scoperta.Carne buonissima e ben servita.Personale disponibile e cortese.Prezzi nella media (50£ con antipasto, carne, bottiglia di vino ed amaro), se si considera la tipologia di ristorante.Location molto carina.Suggerisco carne albese per antipasto e focaccia di formaggio.Ci tornerò!
196: Title: Honest steaks, beware of the maitre!

Review: We visited last month with a group of Greek friends.The maitre was also Greek so we had a pleasant time discussing with him our options. Always good to find someone who speaks "your language" in terms of food.HOWEVER, in two instances he insisted we order dishes which HE would offer for free. We never say no to treats, so we tried both the salad and the desert he suggested. His exact words were like "try the tiramisu, it's on me".Finally though, when the bill came, he disappeared and the bill, of course, included the "free" dishes. It was so awkward.
197: Review: It sounded got from reviews and it looked good when arriving seeing meat hanging in at display in glass coolers in the back.Atmosphere was a bit strange with loud rock music which for me did not match the actually nice decor.The menu was made like a little newspaper and they had lots of good stuff.We ordered and within a short wait got our starter. I got some cold cuts with Parmesan and waited a bit before starting to eat to see if not any bread showed up but I guess I should have ordered that ? I think it is my first time at an Italian restaurant that I did not get bread???Starter was ok and our red wine arrived. The waiter poured and it was probably +25 degree C, so I asked for an ice cooler. The head waiter did also change our glass to some that was chilled and poured our wine over, but it took a while before it had a better temperature. So I did not really enjoy that bottle - which I have had in another vintage and loved.Our food arrived and my steak was really nice. My fennel /blood orange salad was also good even if there was just 2 pcs of blood oranges in it. We skipped dessert and coffee as we were not entirely happy with the place. Some of the food was really good but for me they had a few amateur flaws that takes my rating down.
198: Title: Non sembra di essere a Londra
Review: Ristorante un po’ nascosto ma molto ben curato. La specialità è la carne davvero buonissima . Servizio molto efficiente e professionale . Non do il massimo dei voti in quanto un po’ caro.
199: Title: Not sure get this restaurant at all

Review: I had dinner there with two friends and their grandchildren (aged 7 and 11).Firstly the staff tried to place all five of us along one side of a long trestle table. After some discussion they offered a round table for 5. Why not do that first?And why have two long tables facing each other with a raised runway between them for the staff to serve from? How are people supposed to converse?We spent some time choosing our food and then a waitress turned up to explain how the menu worked! Strange way to behave. If the menu is so hard to understand why not explain it at the start? Pretentious was the word that came to mind.The children chose pasta. The adults wanted steak. The waitress brought a kilo piece of rib and explained that was right for 3 as the bone weighed quite a bit. I was dubious as it seemed too much to me but I was assured it was the right weight. We had a cheese stuffed foccacia to share, which was small. Something twice the size would have been more suitable for our party.The food arrived in dribs and drabs. The children's pasta portions were very small. One just had olive oil on the pasta and the other had a meat sauce. The charge was £11 for each small bowl. The children were still hungry after they had eaten.The beef was good quality but too much for 3 so we had been sold a bigger weight of meat than we needed, despite my original misgivings about the size of the joint. The meat cost £64.The vegetable portions were tiny. The roast potatoes were reheated and tasted unpleasant, the French fries were not very nice and the salad was truly boring.Pudding was fresh pineapple which was very nice but we had to wait ages for service.The wine was a very muddy and flabby Sangiovese at I think £38. It tasted as if it had been stored at too high a temperature.My total bill for a very uninspiring meal was £186, which was excessive for what we had. My conclusion was that we had been pressured into paying too much for the meat, the pasta was wildly over priced and the vegetables were not appetizing. I could have bought the wine on the Internet for less than a third of the price I was charged.I would definitely not go back.
200: Title: Good food but areas of improvement

Review: I was there for my boyfriend birthday with him and a friend.I previously ate in one of the restaurants (Clapham branch) and I loved it.This experience wasn’t as good as the previous ones: we really enjoyed the starters but the cut of the Tbone wasn’t as good as we were expecting, additionally it was a bit too cooked, this is making that kind of cut taste a bit “wild”.I was extremely disappointed by the attitude displayed by one of the waitresses, a blonde Italian girl that literally flirted with my boyfriend in front of me. He was there previously with friends and she welcomed him completely ignoring me and the other guy at the table for the first few minutes, after that she got the orders crouching on his side and putting her hands on his chair. The rest of the staff, the manager (a Greek guy) and the other waitress (Aurora) were instead extremely nice an professional and we got free coffe, liquors and dessert as apology for the steak we mentioned to be too cooked.Overall good experience but as area of improvement I would suggest to train part of the staff to be friendly but maintain professionalism.
201: Review: While staying at Mercure Hotel in Southwark Street we wanted a restaurant that was close by for Sunday evening. Strolled through Old Union Street Arches which was 5 minute walk from hotel and came across this little gem. Apparently there are at least three other branches in London but it came across as being a one off. It's basically a steak restaurant, although pizzas etc are available. The waitress showed us to our table and asked if we had been before. She then proceeded to show us the ropes, explaining the restaurants ethos and where the food was source etc. She then pointed us to 2 large chilled cabinets that were full of large beef joints displayed for all to see. Looking at the display I assumed we were in for a good meal and were not disappointed. We started steak tartare for my wife and Menabrea with gorgonzola for myself. This is basically steak tartare with gorgonzola or dolcalette (I forgot) cheese on top which was then blowtorched at the table to melt the cheese.Both were exceptional starters, not too large or small and very tasty.Followed this with rump steak with pears which was brilliant. The ubiquitous hand cuts chips were really good too. They have a smallish range of desserts and the apple cake was brill. Wine list was on the pricey side but this is London after all.All in all , a great place , fantastic staff and excellent food. Could not have asked for more.
202: Review: What a brilliant find. Went for a pre-theatre meal. The staff were really attentive and friendly and the service was good. The food was just delicious and good size portions. Two courses and wine came to £35 each including Service. Great place.
203: Title: Charge big Londoin prices but delivered low quality.

Review: Not great value, mostly due to not great meat. As a full on red meat restaurant you would expect the quality of the steaks to be high, but they weren't. It was edible but poor. 3 of us shared a 1kg T-Bone that was just not a good cut of meat and it came half medium rear (as we asked for) and half rear. They cooked the rear half a bit more without fuss but not the point. Chips and spinach no better than average and only flavoured ice cream was vanilla and not much of it. Service was OK. All in all not one to go back to.
204: Review: Loca molto carino e caratteristico siamo stati a pranzo carne eccellente cortesia e pulizia ottimi il conto adeguato alla qualità e poi non ci scordiamo eccellenza italiana Il mio consiglio non perdetevi un favoloso pasto
205: Title: Wow - what a surprising find!

Review: Authentic Italian food cooked with verve, and served simply - and enjoyed by Italians, as only the Italians know how!! Only happened upon this restaurant after hunting far & wide for a pub showing the football on the night of the AS Roma vs Liverpool Champions League Semi-Final 2nd leg match, and needing somewhere with some decent food to enjoy afterwards. The bresaola was lovely - sweet & savoury, served simply with rocket & a very firm burrata-style cheese & cherry tomatoes. And my main course, the liver, was cooked perfectly - pink & tender, succulent & sumptuous - and went perfectly with my no-carb side of broccoli with chilli. The service was low-key yet attentive, friendly & enthusiastic. A real gem!!
206: Review: I booked this restaurant as it was convenient to The Union theatre to have a celebration meal in after the show. It is primarily for steak lovers but there are a few other dishes available. The friend I was with is in a wheelchair and the staff could not have been more helpful in making sure that our table was suitable for a wheelchair. When it came to choosing what to eat the relevant cut of steak was shown to you and explained what the cut of meat was and how was the best cooking idea ( (Rare etc) to suite the cut thus enabling you to make a decision as to what weight/cooking you wanted. The meat is hung for a number of weeks and is refrigerated and on view in chill cabinets. As this was my friends 80th birthday they made the evening feel special by providing a few little extras which was unexpected. We felt no pressure to rush our meal and get out and in fact stayed and had a leisurely 3 hour dinner. We ate early in the evening and if our table had been needed we would have vacated. By the time we left which was about 20:00 the restaurant was filling up quite well and from what I could see the other customers all received the same sort of service. The restaurant bills itself as Italian because the meat all comes from Italy. We had sides of vegetables which were quite sufficient for two to share. A very enjoyable experience.
207: Review: It's not cheap, nor does it taste cheap. We had their Ligurian focaccia, a selection of charcuterie, and a rump steak and hanger steak. Fabulous... especially the focaccia and the rump steak. Great food and knowledgable staff and the sharing table is a great way to meet other people.
208: Review: La qualità premia questo locale dove tutto è davvero originale e italiano. Una bellissima carta dei vini, ricercata per nulla scontata con vini biodinamici. Le ricette genovesi ottimamente interpretate e la carne ottima. Servizio attento e premuroso!
209: Review: I am local and decided to try this restaurant at quite a late hour, but this was not a problem. There were still many people and the service we received was exemplary and really could not be faulted. Our dishes were superb, although fries were oversalted. This was remedied very quickly when we raised the subject and a fresh unsalted portion was served very quickly. I had the rump steak which was truly superb - very tender, succulent, tasty and excellently cooked and presented. My colleague had the rib of beef. It came medium rare instead of medium which was very quickly rectified. The ambiance, vibe and lighting were really welcoming and along with the excellent service, food and drinks, we have found our new Steak Heaven!!
210: Review: The food is good but it’s extremely expensive. You end up going away still hungry even if payed a lot of money. The service is ok.
211: Review: Visited on a fairly quiet Sunday night. The focus is very much on the meat and the staff are very knowledgable and give a lot of detail explaining the menu.We started with the steak tartar and the ligurian bakery pissa, a lovely puffy dough, with stracchino cheese and prosciutto which was delicious.For my main I had the rump with pear and balsamic vinegar, very tasty and beautifully cooked. Mr B went for the Costata rib of beef, not a cheap option as you have to order by weight of the meat on the bone being cut to size for you but definitely a case of you get what you pay for, quality meat again beautifully cooked. Mr B is still raving about the taste. Plus, without spoiling the surprise, the added dramatic touch of how the cutlery is presented to you!All accompanied with a lovely Italian Malbec, great meal.
212: Review: Abbiamo scelto questo ristorante per il nostro pranzo di Pasqua e siam stati notevolmente sorpresi. Servizio impeccabile : ogni cameriere è molto attento ad ogni ospite ed é sempre pronto a spiegarti ogni proposta del menù.La carne era tenera morbida e molto saporita. I dolci sia il classico tiramisù sia la proposta della panna cotta al basilico ci hanno stupito.Siamo stati decisamente soddisfatti. Per quanto riguarda il conto; è un pochino caro ma sono soldi decisamente ben spesi.Provatelo!
213: Review: I've stayed many times at a nearby hotel on the southern side of Southwark Bridge, but never noticed this restaurant. I was taken to this restaurant by a friend who highly recommended it. It is one of four Italian restaurants group specializing in meat. We ordered T-bone and rib-eye as well as a couple of vegetable side dishes to be shared by four. We asked the meat cooked medium and sliced for sharing. The served meat was perfectly as we had asked and very tasty. The only flaw was that it was a bit too salty for my taste. The side dishes come in very small portions. It was a relatively expensive meal for lunch.
214: Review: Ho prenotato appositamente nel mio week end londinese dopo esserne stato incuriosito dalla puntata di "4 Ristoranti" e non siamo rimasti delusi. Come traspariva appunto dall'immagine data in televisione, il locale è molto curato in tutti i dettagli che circondano il cliente, sia nell'arredamento che nella scelta dei prodotti quasi esclusivamente italiani. Essendo toscano e amante della carne devo dire che per le scelte che ho fatto dal menù, è un buon posto nel complesso, ma lo stesso pasto in Italia sarebbe costato leggermente meno (cosa comprensibile primo perché sei a Londra e secondo perché appunto vengono somministrati prodotti in maggioranza italiani e certificati). L'altare con il banco carne in fondo al locale è quella chicca che lo rende unico e scenografico...si mangia anche con gli occhi!
215: Review: I am writing this review sitting at the table after the dessert and I am about to go for a 10/10. But then the loud music chang my mind, too loud, ruins the atmosphere since the restaurant was still pretty empty. But this is the end of the "cons".Service was really good. The waiter is polite, knows the menus and does a good explanation of it, how it works, how they serve and where they get their products. Food is excellent, the only exception is the size, probably ravioli course is a bit too small, but really tasty. Totally recommended since the bill is just right and everything was really good. Ps. Dessert are amazing.In breve: Il posto è bello, la cucina davvero molto buona il conto è giusto. Forse la musica era un po troppo alta e avrei gradito qualche raviolo di più. Ma sono cose del tutto trascurabili. Andateci assolutamente.
216: Review: Siamo stati ieri sera in questo ristorante capitandoci per caso, devo dire che è stata un'esperienza piacevole, ottima accoglienza dal personale completamente italiano, carne FAVOLOSA.Piccolo appunto il conto un pochino alto ma siamo a Londra :- 1 Fiorentina di Fassona 750gr- 1 bottiglia di acqua- 2 calici di Vino rosso- 2 dolci- 1 caffè 100,35 £Consigliatissimo!!!!!!
217: Title: Prepare for pushy staff and overly salty food!!

Review: This wasn't a bad meal. Food was good - just very salty!We were shown to an upstairs table, but asked if we could move as there was an overhanging sign on the wall which would have got in the way. This wasn't an issue and we moved to a different table. Chairs weren't very comfortable - but matched the 'industrial' theme. Our waitress came over while we were still looking at the menus and advised us on what the most popular (and most expensive) dishes were. Don't be fooled by the price per kg - the waitress tried to sell us 1.2 kgs of meat to share, which would have been a LOT and very expensive (roughly £6-8 per kilo). We told her we didn't want this much and would get a few sides to go with it. She then told us not to overload on sides (£4.90 each), but to get starters instead as she thought we'd still be hungry, We didn't get starters, but ordered a sharing bread. Again the waitress tried to up sell this and wanted us to buy a plate of meats, however we had to decline this offer a few times!! We had already chosen a bottle of red wine, but when we told her what we wanted, she told us we should get a different, 'stronger, full bodied' red, despite the one we chose being one we liked. She told us the one we chose was 'easy drinking'. She probably didn't like the fact it was one of the cheaper ones on the menu. We enjoyed the food - although had more than enough meat at 1kg. We had a side of potatoes and a side of spinach. Small, but enough to share. Very salty! Probably another technique to sell more drinks!!One of the waiters was passing by when we were pouring out the wine and straight away took away the bottle and asked if we wanted another, despite having another full glass each! We said no, although a different waiter still brought over a new bottle!! We had to tell him it was a no first time!! If you like good meat, this place is good. Just don't let the staff push you to order what you don't want!!
218: Title: Me and best mate recommend!
Review: Every bit meaty and awesome! The service is incredible and price worthy! Great interior and cool location!
219: Review: Focaccia al formaggio buona Bruschetta al lardo molto buona Battuta All'Albese OttimaCostata Super Ambiente ottimo poi non avevamo prenotato ovviamente locale pieno ma ci hanno accontentato servizio ottimo Bravi
220: Title: Cena favolosa in atmosfera familiare

Review: Abbiamo cenato con la mia famiglia, accoglienza familiare, locale arredato con gusto, personale preparatissimo e carne superlativa! Dimenticavo, i dolci anch’ essi spettacolari!!!!! Che dire, da provare assolutamente
221: Review: J'avais réservé ce restaurant avant notre départ pour Londres, pour 19h, à l'occasion de l'anniversaire de mon mari (ceci était une surprise), je connaissais ce restaurant car le patron est passé dans une émission télé italienne, présenter son restaurant. Nous sommes arrivés en avance, vers 18h30, la fille qui s'occupait de nous placer nous a dit qu'il n'y avait aucun problème, une fois installer à notre table cette même fille revient vers nous pour nous dire si en 2 heures nous arrivions à finir notre repas. Ceci ne nous a pas plu du tout à mon mari et à moi, car nous avons bien compris, que c'était parce qu'ils avaient besoin de notre table pour d'autres clients. Ceci n'est pas très professionnel. Mon mari à commander une côte de boeuf, de bonne qualité mais la cuisson était à son avis pas très réussie. Moi j'ai commandé la Focaccia pizzata, que je n'ai franchement pas aimé, sauce tomate acide par dessus. Au moment de vouloir commander le dessert j'ai trouvé très sympas de leur part, ils ont offert une part de gâteau au chocolat avec une bougie, à mon mari, car j'avais mentionné au moment de la réservation que nous allions pour son anni. Par contre, sur les desserts rien a redire, ils sont excellent!!!! J'ai pris un cake aux pommes cannelle avec coulis de caramel, un vrai délice!!!!!L'addition était quand même un peu cher selon nous.Pour ce qui était du service, rien à redire, notre serveuse était très serviable, compétente et prête à répondre à nos questions, nous avons pu communiquer avec elle en italien car ne savons pas l'anglais.
222: Title: Menomale che c’era un buon vino!!!

Review: Gli incredibili sedutisi a tavola, soddisfatti dall’arredamento, dall’atmosfera e dal buon gusto musicale che si poteva sentire in sottofondo erano pronti per una grande mangiata. Gli incredibili notano però che le cameriere in sala sono solo due: già capiscono L’ ANDAZZO. Felici ed in ansia di vedere come verrà cucinata la propria bistecca possono soltanto notare l’energico a tratti violento movimento della chef nel tagliarla, il quale ha come inevitabile conseguenza il fatto che siano presenti pezzi di osso nella carne accompagnati da un ottimo Barolo d’Alba. Ancora speranzosi procedono all’assaggio del dolce, ritenuto soddisfacente. Infine, prezzo a dir poco eccessivo.
223: Review: Ambiente molto carino, su due piani, personale gentile e qualificato, attento alle esigenze del cliente. In tre abbiamo ordinato: focaccia con formaggio, bruschetta al lardo e zuppa di zucca con prosciutto croccante come antipasto e come piatto principale dei ravioli di fassona piemontese e una costata OTTIMA con verdure. I dolci spettacolari, cheese cake e soprattutto il bianco al basilico che consiglio vivamente. Il tutto annaffiato con una bottiglia di ottimo primitivo. Rapporto qualità/prezzo assolutamente interessante. Un ottimo ristorante italiano a Londra. Complimenti!
224: Title: Good but I still prefer the one in South Kensington

Review: Slightly less pretentious than the brother restaurant in South Kensington, it loses a bit of coziness as well. Apart from it, quality is as good and the menu has a few more Genoese/Ligurian specialties which are really great (focaccia al formaggio and pissa!). Big respect for RC.
225: Review: 分厚いステーキを満喫しました。友人と3人で行き、1キロ（Tボーンの骨を含む）食べました。美味しかったです！
226: Review: I decided to take my girlfriend for Valentine's dinner as she always wanted to try the food here.She is a chef and we both have been working in hospitality first in Italy and then in the UK for a long time. Being really interested in this restaurant we booked a table, we were welcomed by a girl at the door, very attentive and welcoming. We sat at our table and three different people came over to take the drinks orders. We got our bottle of wine, quite nice. After getting our bottle of wine we were left for more than 30minutes with our menu. I straight away realised that only a girl was taking orders while the other guy was running food and drinks, we were sat upstairs. When i asked this guy if we could order i was told yes, then he kept on setting up empty tables without even bothering to come over and tell us that only his colleague was taking the orders and that she would have been with us shortly, it is not my job to assume that she can only take orders. I called him a second time and I was told "Yes" again but he never came to our table. My apologies to the girl cause i think i was quite upset when she came over to take our order - she was doing the best she could however her colleague should learn to talk to people not just ignore them. We got to order and after waiting half an hour i was told that what i wanted was not available – normally you should inform the customers once you leave the menus but again the guy didn’t bother, I didn't mind so I changed my order. We had Prosciutto Crudo and Bresaola as starters - nothing special, the quality of the charcuterie was not so bad however the portion was ridiculous and the Stracchino was off. The Pissa Marinara was nice however the tomato sauce was tasteless and a very bad quality. What disappoint me the most was my meat - I was expecting a higher quality and a bigger portion, let alone that the meat was served Rare when I asked for Medium- Rare always better to be undercooked than overcooked in my opion, however as a steak house the cooking of the meat should be impeccable. the Costata was nothing special too. The hand cut chips were not nice at all and the roast potatoes were not too bad. I was so disappointed because this is considered one of the best italian restaurants in London but i do not think the same after visiting, it is a real shame because you would never serve this kind of food (quality wise) in Italy.I was expecting something from this restaurant that was completely deceived. We spent £140 the two of us for not a so special meal. We would never come back again.
227: Review: I brought the masterclass as a Xmas gift for 2 of us. We'd been asked to arrive for 7pm, so choose to arrive 5mins early- however found the class had started when we got there. We'd luckily only missed a few minutes.The class takes place above the restaurant, on an upper open planned 2nd floor. The chef taking the class had a lovely, albeit softly spoken Italian accent, which unfortunately got drowned out a midst the restaurant music & noise from below. I'd assumed it'd be in a different room or the chefs may have mics at least to help us hear what was being said; I did offer this as a recommendation after. It was a lot of listening and not as hands on as I'd hoped, but still the bits we heard were interesting and the meat was impressive.We felt a little awkward as the class was already settled when we arrrived- so we appreciated the quick re-cap by one of the team, but it was 45mins later until we were offered a drink as the session was still going. This aside, the wine was great.The chef made a French and an Italian steak tartare which we all got to try- it tasted amazing. So too did the 3x course meal that followed inc cured meats, fresh garlic bread, steak & vegetables and a trio of desserts. It was all cooked incredibly well.The staff were friendly and service smooth. It's an expensive gift but seemed good as a unique treat. However, in retrospect, we'd probably skip the class which held little value unfortunately, and just go for the dining bit which was hands down the best part. We're keen to visit the other Macellaio- but certainly just to dine next time.
228: Review: Ottimo ristorante!!! Location curata e bellissima atmosfera! Personale gentile e professionale. Cibo molto buono! Sia la carne, ma anche pasta e pizza si difendono bene. Consiglio il dolce al Basilico, molto particolare! In mezzo ai ristoranti londinesi non ha rivali!! Giusto rapporto qualità/prezzo.. (si paga un po' ..ma che volete .. siamo a Londra!!!)
229: Title: Very expensive and tiny portions

Review: Been here on Friday. The location is cool but a bit hidden, therefore difficult to find. This Italian steak house has normo prices, but the portions are soo tiny that you have to order more, therefore you end up spending lots of money. My steak was nice, but so little! And the sides.. to small. The roasted potatoes were dry, while the spinach and mash just average. We ordered a ligurian pizza which was really small. The desserts as well costs 5-6£ and you get a massive plate containing a microscopic portion. I amNot sure I can afford to pay £40 again for a dinner there! If I think I spent €12 in Italy and I ate a massive fiorentina I want to cry.
230: Review: Eccellente la carne, il servizio, l'accoglienza, la gentilezza, l'ambiente.Una ottima esperienza, torno con molto piacere. Mio marito ha mangiato una bisteccona di quasi un kilo, deliziosa!! Io una tagliata veramente tenera e gustosa. Il locale è piccolo ma molto accogliente, e tutto il personale super professionista. Era da tanto tempo che non mangiavo in un locale dove si vede che la gente lavora con passione.
231: Review: We saw that restaurant as winner of Italian series "4 Ristoranti" from Alessandro Borghese on 2016.It definitely deserves that reward!The meat is tasteful, tender and delicious. Only well matured and local Fassona. Fabulous!Best cooking is rare or medium-rareAll sides are very good and well served. Hand maded Focaccia as well. Wine list offers several choices even at glass. The wines are a bit expensive.Service is kind and they explain perfectly the way they made all the dishes in the menu.One weaky point is timing of serving. They should speed up a bit and avoid the meat standing on 'the pass' for more than 5 minutes. The meat can overcook or cool down...100% promoted. I will come back there when I will be in London again. For sure.
232: Review: A combination of factors had me looking for a Wednesday evening dinner for me and my daughter in the Southwark area.Having previously enjoyed Union St Cafe, we tried there, but they were booked for a private event. The ever helpful kitchen team did ask if I’d like a recommendation though, and accepting the kind offer, we were directed to Macellaio.The very enthusiastic recommendation was completely deserved, with great food and excellent service. Whilst not strictly a “family” targeted restaurant (ie no specific children’s menu) they accommodated my daughters requirements very well. She had a pizza (without dairy) that she described as “awesome”. The quality of the meats (over all we had 4 dishes), spoke volumes when being eaten. The ingredients were allowed to speak for themselves as such.If we didn’t have steak waiting to be cooked at home, the fridge containing the racks of meat was extremely tempting and appetising, and might have swung me away from the pasta options. It says something when my daughter was asking if we could visit every week, and listing who she’d like to take along too. It was a long list.It’s unlikely to be possible to visit every week, but is definitely one to return to soon. Very soon.
233: Review:  Fantastic!I had a dinner with my girlfriend tonight(it was her birthday)and we really enjoyed it,why?Because the staff took care of us and they were very kind and helpful(especially Alessandra,the waitress)she gave us a lots of advices which have been very useful!Pissa and carpaccio very very good(as the Italian style wants) but very congratulations for the costata!I’ll be there again for sure.
234: Title: Ottima carne ottimo il servizio

Review: Ci siamo presentati in questo ristorante sotto indicazione di alessandro borghese.Buona la qualità della carne, bella ma piccola la location, un po’ difficile da trovare.Gentilissimo il personale, si respira aria Italiana.consiglio vivamente e ci ritornerò sicuramenteOttimo qualità prezzo
235: Review: Per chi si trova a Londra e vuole mangiare della buona carne consiglio di venire qui! Personale gentile e disponibile. Bella la location. Se siete nei dintorni fateci un pensierino!
236: Review: Finalmente ,dopo tanto cercare ho trovato il locale giusto per me!! Che dire tutto eccezionale e con una qualità unica !! Proprietario gentilissimo ( Friuliano) e cordialissimo...Eravamo in tre , 2 bruschette al lardo dal gusto irripetibile ,2 tagliate fantastiche e un primo ,(Gnocchi gustosissimi)! Il tutto con un conto a dir poco sotto le attese!! COMPLIMENTI . La prossima volta sarò vostro ospite per più sere!!
237:
Review: Wow, what a steak!

Highly recommend this place, was absolutely delicious. The bread was also mouthwatering. I am now stuffed and had a fantastic lunch.
238: Review: Sono stata in questo ristorante con degli amici, ricordandomi della puntata di '4 ristoranti' ed avendo voglia di mangiare carne. Il locale ha uno stile ricercato ed un po' drammatico. Il servizio è molto attento e cortese, i piatti arrivano velocemente e sono ben curati. Il cibo è semplicemente fantastico! La qualità della carne è altissima e trattata con molta cura, cosa che si apprezza nel cotto ma ancora di più nel crudo. Il prezzo è un po' salato, però contando le materie prime offerte, é ben giustificato. In totale abbiamo ordinato due antipasti di crudo, una fiorentina da 1kg da dividere in due ed una tagliata, un contorno, due dolci, un caffè, una bottiglia di acqua ed una di cabernet per una spesa di 149£. Lo consiglio per una cena con amici, nella quale si vuole fare una bella figura e mangiare carne di buona qualità.
239: Review: Carne veramente eccezionale, personale gentile e preparato in una location molto tranquilla e rilassata.Ottima carta dei vini e buon rapporto qualità/prezzo.Complimenti!
240: Review: Ristorante italiano dove lavorano praticamente solo italiani!! Menu di carne con prezzi di lunga sotto la media di Londra!! Materie prime eccezionali, pizza fatta in casa ottima!! Tartare e carpaccio ottimi!! Tagliata e costata molto buone, gran bella carta dei vini dove si possono trovare buone opzioni a prezzi ragionevoli, consiglio a tutti di farci un salto.
241: Review: I booked this restaurant for my boyfriend's birthday dinner on 24/12. Not only were they open unlike many other places, they also didn't force a set Christmas menu. We had 3 starters - bone marrow, tartar and tripe. For the main we ordered a 800g rib of beef to share. The meat was delicious and cooked to perfection!At the end of the meal my boyfriend got a complimentary chocolate cake with a candle which was a really nice touch.The restaurant is dog friendly and our pooch was able to celebrate with us.
242: Review: Went there for a team lunch last week and found the staff to be every welcoming and helpful. They explained everything and helped us understand the menu. The place is fairly expensive but as one says, you get what you pay for. They are meat professional and unless you are very very very, etc. demanding, it cannot go wrong. I will go back and strongly recommend
243: Title: Piece of real Italy in London

Review: I found this restaurant after visiting Tate Modern. The staff seem mainly to be Italian, and are very pleasant, with efficiernt, friendly and unobtrusive service. There are chill fridges containing interesting looking large cuts of beef, all well aged; it's obvious they take their meat seriously here (they call it Butchery with Tables). However, as it was lunchtime we were in the mood for something lighter and ordered the Focaccia Pizzata, which turned out to be a rather unusual and completely delicious pizza with a double very thin base with light cheese between the layers and topped with tomato sauce, beautiful olives, capers and anchovies. Although they have other outlets, this dish doesn't seem to be available at the others. The music was excellent and perfectly suited to the clientele (also lots of Italians, who all seemed to know each other, lots of hugging and animated chat). The coffee they serve is really delicious. An excellent find, I am looking forward to an evening visit, when I shall try their excellent-looking meat.
244: Review: Siamo andati a cercare questo locale durante una visita a Londra, dopo averlo visto nel programma 4 Ristoranti di Alessandro Borghese.La zona è molto carina, viva, piena di gente e bella da vivere anche la sera.Il locale è molto carino con la macelleria a vista, che personalmente mi piace se non ci sono troppo vicino.Anche la cucina è a vista.Una pecca secondo me che ci sono pochi tavoli singoli (almeno al piano terra), quindi se ci si va in compagnia occorre stare ai tovoloni lunghi, con altre persone e situazione un po' difficile per la conversazione.La cucina è buona, in realtà ci siamo affidati ai primi e meritano.
245: Title: In perfetta linea con le aspettative!

Review: Non sto a ripetervi quanto di positivo potete leggere nelle recensioni degli altri per quanto concerne la qualità e la bontà del cibo, sarei ridondante.Mi preme sottolineare altri aspetti.Ero con amici, abbiamo prenotato per le 21 (venerdì 8 dicembre), siamo arrivati con leggero anticipo e, nonostante la notevole presenza di clienti in attesa di un tavolo, il nostro era già pronto (vi chiedo: quante volte vi è capitato, nel bel mezzo di un week end, di aspettare minimo un quarto d'ora pur avendo prenotato?).Una volta accomodati una cameriera dotata dell'entusiasmo di chi ama il proprio lavoro (e che sicuramente avrà anche lei i suoi bei pensieri ma non te li fa pesare...) si è avvicinata spiegando le caratteristiche del locale e il metodo di conservazione della carne esposta agli occhi della clientela. Lo stesso atteggiamento premuroso è riscontrabile negli altri.Si mettono in gioco con una trasparenza che non lascia spazio a fraintendimenti; anche la cucina è in bella vista.Il servizio è veloce; la cortesia, seppur in un contesto frenetico, non manca mai.Non so voi ma a queste caratteristiche do un peso enorme.I prezzi sono in linea con la qualità.Vi invito ad andarci e a mandarmi a quel paese se non vi troverete bene come ci siamo trovati noi.
246: Review: Siamo stati qui il 7/12, locale molto particolare, giusta atmosfera per un'ottima cena. La carne fassona, che abbiamo preso, di prima scelta, così come il coniglio, che non è facile trovare a Londra. Il servizio è stato curato da Eva, che si è dimostrata molto professionale e simpatica, il che non guasta. Ci torneremo alla prossima occasione.
247: Review: My boyfriend and me tried this restaurant mainly because it's Alessandro Borghese's, so we couldn't go wrong.And the restaurant nailed it!First of all the service was excellent, friendly and smooth.The waitress that served us was really kind and knew how to answer all of our questions regarding the different dishes, sizes and ingredients with an accurate manner.The place is beautiful, modern and warm, with wooden tables and soft lights.The menu is original, newspaper shaped and styled, not too rich and not too poor, just perfect.We had Battuta Albese, which is a splendid tartare (when you order it add some salt, oil and pepper to make it more flavoury) and pissa with tomato and stracchino. Both amazing.Ravioli with al tocco were good, nothing over the top but still very nice.The two steaks we ordered (skirt stake and rump steak with goronzola) were stunning, absolutely delicious! So juicy and tender.To end this beautiful dinner we had a tiramisu to share, very cute packaging and nice flavour, and an espresso.I really recommend this restaurant, prices are abordable and food quality is superb! Don't miss it!
248:
Review: Thank you Macellaio Rc Union Street team
for makes our evening very special! ⭐️
Lovely location, friendly staff, amazing service and very tasty food!! 💯🤩
249: Title: Amazing foods and great customer service in London

Review: I've been with my boyfriend who was so excited to eat there. The food is well presented and so delicious, the staff is professional and the place is really cosy. In addition, an excellent value for the money.
250: Title: Ottima carne ma i vini ....

Review: Uno dei 4 locali presenti a Londra con la stessa insegna tipico italiano di fascia medio alta , vincitore di 4 ristoranti Sky . Locale non molto grande in un posto facile da raggiungere con la metro , personale cortese e disponibile. Carne ottima. Carta dei vini ottima ma con prezzi 4 volte il loro valore commerciale. Focaccia da non perdere. Dolci buoni. Prezzi superiori alla media .
251: Review: My friends and I decided to come here for dinner on a Sunday night. It was a bit late so they weren’t that busy. They sat us down promptly and then the waitress (which I don’t remember the name but very professional) gave us some advices on what to go for. Some starters, a pasta dish, and a 1.5kg cut of amazing steak, cooked perfectly, followed with few side orders. Everything was top notch. At the end we had some room left for dessert, so we did order it, and it was superb.I’ve read a lot of comments about the bill... well my personal opinion: you pay for what you get, can’t expect to pay less than what we’ve spent for the good quality food we ate. But lot of people don’t get that, and complain... well guys, you are doing a great job! Keep it up!
252: Review: We went here on the last day in June as part of our seven week holiday travelling Europe from Australia. We were a group of 4 staying in the area and did a google map to find restaurants. We were initially heading to Bala Baya but as this restaurant was right next door we had trouble walking past the people dining outside with what looked to be lovely steaks on their plates. This ended up being a great decision. I believe our waiter was Enzo and he was amazing and very attentive. Not sure what Lemoncello we had to finish off the evening meal but was the best we had and we tried a lot of it during our time in Italy. This dinner was a highlight of our trip. Food, service and ambiance upstairs was just fantastic. Meal certainly wasn't cheap but not a lot was in England compared to Italy. Would definitely go back if we ever got back to England again.
253: Review: Siamo stati qui venerdi sera a cena, previa prenotazione, sull'onda della trasmissione di Borghese "4 ristoranti".L'ambiente era quello che ci aspettavamo, anche se più piccolo..arredamento industriale urbano con tanto di altare dove si dovrebbe celebrare la carne.Il nostro tavolo era piuttosto vicino all'ingresso, ma per fortuna non così tanto da sentire il freddo che hanno sentito le ragazze accanto a noi.Il menù viene distribuito sotto forma di pagina di giornale, idea originale ma pericolosa perchè così si sporca e stazzona facilmente.Per antipasto non abbiamo potuto scegliere più di tanto a causa di gusti personali e allergie quindi abbiamo ripiegato sulle crocchette di bollito: 3 di numero, abbastanza buone ma totalmente insipide.Per secondo ci siamo concessi una fiorentina da 650gr e un hanger steak (taglio sulla schiena).Fiorentina molto buona e hanger steak interessante, anche se la quantità è stata piuttosto insoddisfacente rapportata al prezzo.Il Ruchè che abbiamo preso, invece, non ci ha soddisfatto per nulla forse perchè vegano.Per fortuna, la panna cotta al basilico ha risollevato la situazione.Camerieri molto simpatici e affabili ma l'abilità nel servizio è un'altra cosa e qui manca sicuramente ancora molto se si vuole giustificare un conto da circa GPB 130, considerato poi che siamo a Union Street.
254: Title:  Carne buona,peccato per i dettagli

Review: Ristorante decisamente originale,il design è un po’ industrial e un po’ kitch.La fassona si presenta bene ed e’ molto buona come la pizza come antipasto ma il pollo e le patate decisamente troppo condite. Non ci tornerei perché il servizio non era attento e ci ha assegnato un tavolo davvero scomodoNonostante la prenotazione.
255: Title: London style casual steak house
Review: Nice typical london style steakhouse, butchersplace. Amazing meat, wine and starters, really good service and cosy place!
256: Review: In occasione di un breve weekend a Londra abbiamo voluto provare questo ristorante in seguito alla vittoria durante il programma di Alessandro Borghese, quattro ristoranti . Innanzitutto il locale si trova all'interno di un piccolo cortile e non è facilmente individuabile dalla via principale virgola tant'è che abbiamo impiegato un pochino per trovarlo. All'interno dello stesso cortile c'è anche un altro locale il che non rende facile l'individuazione. Forse influenzati dal l'idea che ci eravamo fatti guardando il programma televisivo, una volta entrati siamo rimasti un po' delusi dalla dimensione del locale, molto più piccolo e Modesto di quanto ci era sembrato in tv. Il servizio e cordiale Cortese virgola giovane e informale. Ci hanno fatto accomodare nella sala sul soppalco che risulta un po' cupa e poco illuminata ma arredata in stile moderno e piacevole . Il menù è piuttosto vario e i prezzi non certo abbordabili, il che è ampiamente giustificabile per i piatti a base di carne , dei quali abbiamo potuto apprezzare l'eccellente qualità, ma molto meno giustificabile in riferimento ai piatti di pasta o agli antipasti. Pertanto Sconsiglio di abbinare ai piatti di carne o un primo o un antipasto perché totalmente fuori prezzo. La carta dei vini È ottima con scelte anche non sempre scontate per un locale a Londra . Nel complesso ci siamo trovati bene, anche se credo che la nostra curiosità sia stata soddisfatta e non credo tornerei una seconda volta.
257: Review: Siamo andati in questo locale a cena e siamo stati accolti calorosamente. Un simpatico friulano ci ha spiegato con dettagli e passione particolari delle carni utili alla nostra scelta. Abbiamo deciso di mangiare una grande fiorentina da dividere in 4 con vari contorni. Tutto eccellente! Ottimi anche i dessert in particolare l'originale panna cotta al basilico. All'altezza la carta dei vini. Un particolare...hanno capito che festeggiavamo un compleanno e alla fine hanno portato un brownie con la candelina....un'attenzione molto gradida! Il prezzo a seconda delle scelte puo' diventare medio alto ma ritengo sia meritato in particolare tenendo conto dei prezzi di Londra.
258: Review: Dopo aver visto la puntata di Borghese, essendo a Londra non potevo non cenare da loro. Ho prenotato online con opentable, tavolo pronto 1 minuto prima. Ho mangiato una focaccia al formaggio molto buona, ma il punto forte è stata la costata di fassona cotta alla perfezione e veramente molto tenera. Conclusa la cena con una delizione cheese cake.
259: Review: Confesso che sono andato in questo ristorante italiano per complimentarmi con il sig.roberto costa, dopo aver vinto la gara di Alessandro borghese, per la sua signorilità, caratteristica ormai di difficile reperibilità. Me lo sono trovato accanto a spiegarmi con molta competenza il piatto che avevo scelto e dopo averlo conosciuto e scambiato due parole confermo quanto mi sarei aspettato. Veniamo comunque al cibo , ottima la focaccia di riecco , roberto è ligure, ottima la carne ben presentata e ben cotta, ambiente easy e socievole conto degno di un ristorante di questo tipo. Dimenticavo roberto ci ha offerto il dolce. Chapeau.
260: Review: Durante un viaggio di lavoro a Londra mi ci hanno portato mia cugina e il suo ragazzo che vivono li. E' stato il vincitore della trasmissione di Alessandro Borghese "4 ristoranti" in uno speciale girato a Londra. Che dire... carne di qualità cucinata alla perfezione e servita ottimamente. Il personale è stato gentilissimo e ci ha consigliato su cosa prendere. Consiglio come antipasto la focaccia in teglia... strepitosa....Da provare.
261: Review: As far as steakhouses go this is very good. Service was good perhaps could be a little more attentive. Had the fillet steak which was cooked exactly as asked. Choices in starters perhaps not as varied as other I’d like from a restaurant and it was my own opinion that a choice of accompanying sauce would also been nice but they don’t have this choice.I would rate this place second to another chain of well known steak establishments. Overall very pleased and reasonably priced. I would go back to try the other variety of steak.
262: Title: Almost perfect Italian steak house, slightly let down by the service

Review: Macellaio is an Italian steakhouse situated under the railway arches on Union Street about 200m from Southwark tube station. The restaurant has a nice cosy atmosphere and the food is excellent. On our visit the place wasn't full and had a good vibe but our experience was slightly let down by a service mistake as a result of the servers trying to impress by remembering everything instead of writing it down, and as a result forgetting two things from the order. It's not rocket science, just write it down and avoid this issue. I'd rather have the confidence that you got my order correct than be impressed with your memory tricks.Even though the place wasn't full our mains still took a very long time to arrive but the manager spotted the problem and brought us a plate of cured meats to keep people's mouth's occupied while our steaks were prepared.The steaks themselves were excellent, I thoroughly recommend avoiding the high pressure "upsell" for the T-Bone or Rib Eye specials (and the associate cost) and suggest the rump steaks which were tasty and very tender.
263: Review: Not surprisingly this restaurant is heavily biased towards the meat eater. 2 of us went there one a carnivore and the other a veggie. On the positive side the the steak was very good, there is a good extensive wine list and the service was very good. On the negative side the 2 veggie options I ate were not great. The cheese and leek tart was burnt and the pesto pasta bitter tasting and lacking in seasoning. I ordered ice cream for dessert, but they discovered they had run out and as I did not want an alternative they gave us a glass of wine free. In my opinion if you are going to provide veggie options at least make an effort!The toilet facilities were also not up to scratch. The ladies had obviously not been checked for sometime and the door to the ladies which opened directly onto the restaurant kept opening. Apparently in the men's toilet there was a large hole in the wall.
264: Review: Scoperto per puro caso, attirato dai molti locali di Union Street Arch. Non avevo prenotato, ma gentilmente mi hanno trovato subito un posto. Ho ordinato Focaccia con lo stracchino (praticamente la focaccia di Recco fatta a mo’ di pizza): porzione abbondante per 2 e valida anche per 4, dato che è un antipasto. Nonostante siano specializzati in bistecche ho poi ordinato il coniglio, raro da trovare nei ristoranti. Cotto alla piastra, con patate fritte. Davvero ottimo. Ottima lista di vini. Servizio gentile e solerte, con molte cameriere che parlano italiano. Prezzo corretto con buon rapporto rispetto alla qualità del cibo servito. Ci tornerò certamente.
265: Review: Serata non pianificata, terrorizzati dall'idea dell'ennesimo McDonald's...una battuta all'albese semplicemente perfetta, costata di carne piemontese paradisiaca, e ottima selezione di vini. Il tutto a prezzi "londinesi" ma non così eccessivi. Da segnare tra i posti dove tornare di sicuro.
266: Review: Great sharing meat sharing dishes. We had a T-bone steak, the quality was outstanding. Probably slightly oversold on the quantity we would need. Nice atmosphere
267: Title: Nice presentation, good service but nothing out of the ordinary

Review: A small of group us done our usual thing of going to a restaurant after seeing a film, in this instance, "Thor:Ragnarok".Firstly I'd like to mention that it was my first visit to "Macellaio" whereas the others have been previously and talked good things. Like other reviewers the restaurant is hidden along Union Street heading towards the Shard/London Bridge.The atmosphere for a Wednesday evening was jovial and not packed to the rafters. Quiet enough to have a decent conversation but not overly loud where you had to scream/shout to hear each other or extremely quiet where you can hear other patrons conversations.My starter was penne pasta with tomatoes. I was clearly impressed that the pasta seemed to be freshly made and tasted good. I chose "rabbit" as my main meal accompanied with salad and cherry tomatoes. The rabbit was cooked well and was decent. As it is was my first tasting of rabbit I cannot really judge on its quality.Did not order any alcohol but the wine list seemed to offer a good selection though no Rose was available to purchase. Did not look at the dessert menu so I shan't comment on dessert.All in all, it was a satisfactory dining experience but in my opinion nothing really above the ordinary.Will go again to sample their steaks as that seemed to be their speciality.
268: Title: Cadre original et viande de qualité

Review: Nous avons choisi ce restaurant du fait de sa proximité avec le métro Southwark Le restaurant est niché dans l’arche d’un pont L’intérieur est original avec une vue sur l’ensemble des viandes serviesLe repas est excellent, la viande de très grande qualité. Le service est parfait et l’accueil très agréable Allez y les yeux fermés
269: Title: Farebbe innamorare pure un vegano!

Review: Complimenti a Roberto Costa per il locale e la mission che abbraccia tutto il progetto Macellaio.Ospite di un amico, ho accettato con interesse l’invito a cenare in questo locale.Un posto da visitare, sia per degustare la qualità dei prodotti ma soprattutto per comprendere l’idea che vi sta dietro, la passione per “il prodotto carne” e il servizio verso il cliente.Lascio commentare le immagini, valgono più di mille parole.Prezzi allineati al market londinese ma prodotto Made in Italy senza eguali qui a Londra.Assolutamente consigliato.Un plauso a Roberto Costa, allo staff del locale e a tutti quelli che hanno contribuito all’ingresso dell’italian food qui a Londra.
270: Review: Dopo aver visto una puntata di 4 ristoranti di Alessandro borghese, abbiamo deciso di provare questo ristorante: l'ambientazione è davvero pittoresca, il menù ricercato e tipicamente italiano! Consigliato!
271: Title: Good food with an informal and friendly atmosphere

Review: Other that it's a bit hard to find, this restaurant offers a high quality Italian experience. If you like grilled meat, you should definitely go here. Perfect for first date since it's a bit hidden and private.
272: Review: Pur arrivando verso le 10.30 di sera, l’accoglienza e la disponibilita’ mi e’ piaciuta molto. Si mangia bene, diversi tipi di carne e altri piatti liguri come la focaccia al formaggio.Ambiente low profile e giovane, lo consiglio per serate con amici ma anche cene di lavoro.
273: Title: Macellaio is a real Italian food experience

Review: It is rare to find a place like this in London. Italian food is something that not many people understand, especially in the British capital and more often I've come to the conclusion that there is only one way to experience it: in Italy. I visited Macellaio a couple of days ago with a group of friends and it tasted like home. We tried a couple of starters, bruschetta with lardo, the steak tartare, battuta with gorgonzola and the Ligurian pissa with ham. They were simply divine. As a main, we opted for a rib-eye steak and I have rarely had meat that tasted so good during my years in London: it melted in my mouth.The sides were also good but The service was excellent, we were sitting upstairs and the waitress was incredibly nice and answered all the questions my British friends had about the menu and explained exactly why the meat is so special.I will definitely come back and bring more friends; I am so happy I found this restaurant. It is a real Italian food experience.
274: Review: We loved the stakes. Although they made a mistake between my order and my wife and daughter ( instead of medium for me and medium well for them they made the opposite) but they corrected their mistake. And offered free desert. The service is perfect. The decorations is beautiful.
275: Title: Posto fantastico peccato per il servizio

Review: Il design e l'arredamento del locale meritano molto. Cucina altrettanto ottima, peccato per il servizio: attese molto lunghe e un paio di dimenticanze da parte dei camerieri dopo ripetuti solleciti.
276: Review: En week-end en Famille à Londres, nous logions un hotel à côtéOn y est allé un peu par hasard, on recherchait au début un Resto + typique anglais mais bon... au final pas déçu car la serveuse à bien pris le temps de nous expliquer les différents plats (car on est pas bilingue anglais!) et la viande était excellentesPar contre pas de menu enfant, mais des pizzas et des gnocchi maison qd mêmeEt des prix assez élevés
277: Title: Wow! The Dry Aged Beef the way I like it!

Review: Amazing interior decoration. Excellent service. Delicious meat. Perfect choice of wines. Good price. We ordered Battuta all'albese, Bollito Croquettes and Pissa tomato and stracchino as starters: delicious. The Barbera wine was very fine. As main courses we order T-Bone and Prime Rib. All meat is dry aged 7-8 weeks, cooked exactly as it should be, and fond in our mouth with the delicious scents typical of dry aged meat. Prime Rib is more tender than T-Bone. We close with Tiramisu and Basil Panna Cotta. Wow! Thank you, and see you soon!
278: Title: Just the best steak in london
Review: Fantastic focaccia bread full of cheese followed by an amazing steak. Been every month since they opened- love it.
279: Review: Un’altra conferma dell’ottima qualità delle materie prime e dell’attenzione per il cliente ... un piccolo problema con il pure’, peraltro di norma eccezionale, e si sono subito attivati sostituendo il contorno e offrendo addirittura entrambi i dolci! Un grazie a tutta la “crew” in particolare ad Eva che ci ha seguite e coccolate per tutta la cena! Inutile sottolineare che torneremo presto!!
280: Review: Non possiamo farne a meno. Almeno una serata a Londra è al MACELLAIO.Questa volta però mi son segnato il peso della bistecca. La prossima volta... più GRANDE.Carne spettacolare, ma anche la focaccia. Non ho mai avuto il piacere di conoscere il proprietario per fargli i complimenti, non c'è mai. Personale super gentile, specialmente la ragazza all'ingresso e il ragazzo napoletano.Non vedo l'ora di tornarci e lo consiglio vivamente.We can not help it. At least an evening in London is at MACHINE.This time, however, I have the weight of the steak. Next time ... GREAT.Spectacular meat, but also the focaccia. I've never had the pleasure of knowing the owner to compliment him, never there. Super friendly staff, especially the girl at the entrance and the Neapolitan boy.I can not wait to go back and would highly recommend it
281: Review: Incuriositi dalla trasmissione di Borghese abbiamo cenato in questo ristorante. Ottima carne. Bell' ambiente. Servizio cortese. Prezzi Inglesi. Da provare
282: Review: Definitely worth a a visit. Great food , the service is so efficient!! They have their own butchery and bakery on site. They take food allergy so seriously and they are happy to alter their dishes in order to accommodate special requests.Wine list is quite satisfactory although for a place like this I was expecting more international choices.Their brother at the Old Brompton road is equally good but much smaller place.
283: Review: La carne era ottima (e ci mancherebbe altro visto il nome del locale) ma... ...ma non è accettabile che non ci fosse il filetto, così come non è perdonabile la povertà dei liquori da prendere a fine pasto. Se poi vuoi fare il ristorante italiano, credo che la tartare (buonissima) debba prevedere anche il tuorlo d'uovo, cosa che non è stata possibile neanche su richiesta.
284: Review: Friends get together we met at this place. The concept is dry aged Italian beef so not for veggies! Starters variations on raw meat i.e. Carpaccio, tartar etc . Nice. T bone main dish to share between 2 or fillet/ rib eye. Nicely cooked and good flavour but we were expecting it to be really good it was nice but not sensational. Desserts ok. Smallish portions and expensive for what we got at around £60 head.
285: Review: First up: the food was excellent! 3 star rating reflects the fact that it was atrocious value for money...I had burrata, which was amazing. The menu says it comes with rocket and cherry tomatoes. Yeah right! 3 rocket leaves and 1 tomato cut in half! Seriously???? I'd asked the waiter if I might need to order a side of salad, he said no "it comes with it". I was absolutely speechless!That said, my partner's foccacia was fine and a sensible portion.Tiramisu was miniscule.Oh dear... I won't be rushing back.
286: Review: ... ho mangiato una bistecca favolosa e non solo!!!!il personale è gentilissimo e il rapportoq qualità prezzo considerando di stare a Londra e la qualità del cibo è veramente buono. Ci tornerò al 100%
287: Title: So much promise but such a disappointment

Review: The meal started so well with friendly, attentive service explaining about the source and flavour of the meat they use and guided us nicely on starters and weight of meat to use for the mains. The selected starters were excellent and it all set the scene nicely. Unfortunately, the main courses were a real let down; the rump steak was raw when we asked for medium rare and when it returned 5 minutes later looked no different. My wife and I shared a 700g rib steak and this too was an incredible disappointment. The long ageing process hadn't added flavour and we were barely left with the equivalent meat of two 6 ounce steaks after the lumps of fat had been removed. The platter that the rib was served on contained more fat than meat. My daughters pasta dish was good but she was left still hungry such was the small portion size. The manager provided complimentary deserts but the damage had been done and the experience was ruined. It ended up an expensive meal and to add insult the bill included a service charge that took account of the complimentary deserts!
288: Review: We so enjoyed our meal on Saturday night, friendly staff, sensible advice on wine choice and the chance to sample before we chose.The theatre of seeing your meat before it is cooked is fun and gets the taste buds watering.Fabulous fresh food.Advice - choose a couple of starters and share
289: Review: We loved this restaurant! The food is so nice, the area is very cute! A lovely outside area. Staff are so helpful. Would definitely come back and recommend it :)
290: Review: A couple of weeks ago we looked in at Macellio in Exmouth market. I looked amazing for meat lovers. All that tasty meat hanging in fridges. Looking rather impressive. We salivated at the thought, but had just eaten. So yesterday, being back in London for a very special appointment we thought we try Macellaio for an iron, protein injection of really good steak!! We were early so only a couple of other covers. I ordered rump steak with Olive oil and salt. My partner ordered the beef shoulder steak. We had 2 sides. A bean dish which was tasty and broccoli with fresh chill but only 1 sliver of chill..... my steak was under done and really chewy and a little cold! I also didn't like the way it was presented, all sliced up and fanned out on a hot slate! Didn't look nice! The should steak was also cut up into tiny slivers that filled a plate. It looked grey!! That too was chewy. I sent my rump steak back. Now I know rump steak isn't the best cut of steak, but cooked well it can be very tasty and this just wasn't! My next steak was just as bad.... I sent that back too. So after sending my first steak back I sat and watched my partner eat his and our sides which were going cold not happy and the whole meal was a disappointing disaster!
291: Review: Siamo andati una sola Volta. Locale alla moda, personale quasi totalmente italiano. La cura per le materie prime, la carne in particolare, estremamente ricercata. Tutto ottimo, prezzi alti ma giustificati per la qualità offerta.
292: Review: Incuriositi da quanto proposto a "4 Ristoranti" su Sky siamo andati per Pasqua in questo ristorante. A parte lo smarrimento iniziale in quanto non trovavano la prenotazione fatta, ci davano comunque immediatamente un tavolo. Pensando che eravamo in 8 ... Una volta seduti è iniziato quanto più di bello ci si possa immaginare. Ottimo servizio, con spiegazione dei piatti e delle varie possibilità. Ottimo cibo, tutto veramente buono. La carne spettacolare. Ok vino e tutto il resto. Un po' pienotti abbiamo saltato il dessert.Ci siamo trovati talmente bene che abbiamo riservato subito anche per la sera dopo. Qui abbiamo provato anche i dessert, ottimi anche quelli.Ci torneremo di sicuro.Complimenti.
293: Title: Great steak and Italian Meats

Review: Dined her with my sister. Has lovely courtyard outside for pre drinks and a few table too outside however English weather dependant. Service was good and waitress was knowledgable. We ordered steak tartare and beef Carpaccio to steady followed by 600g Costata steak with side of fries and steam broccoli. Was more than enough and the steak was £37.20 so very cheap for the quantity and the quality was superb ! Can definalty recommend if you want a steak fix but don't want to pay a Gaucho / Hawksmoor price! Very good and will be back.
294: Review: I had heard good things about this restaurant, so visited with the Mrs Saturday evening. We sat outside, though there was a bit of smoke exiting the extractor, it wasn't too bad. The interior looked nice, but you don't often get the chance to eat outside in London. The restaurant is well hidden down a little hidden street that has a few bars and restaurants. We shared focaccia stuffed with cheese to start and it was delicious. Really tasty. We followed that up with a 1kg rob eye, done medium-rare, with a couple of sides. I am. It sure I have ever eaten better steak than that and I have eaten in many good steak places. Was absolutely delicious. Flavoursome and seasoned well, but also melted in the mouth. Absolutely fabulous. We washed it down with a nice Barolo. The staff were friendly and knowledgeable. Overall a fantastic experience and we shall definitely be returning
295: Review: This is one of my favourite places to eat in London.  The staff are amazingly friendly and efficient.  The food is absolutely delicious and satisfying - I have never left hungry! Ever! Great location for a special treat.
296: Title: Viva il Piemonte! ( ...e non solo...)

Review: Finalmente un ristorante Italiano lontano dai soliti stereotipi tipo Pizza /Mandolino... L'Italia, per fortuna, non è solo Bella Napoli e dintorni...Visitato prima di vedere la Trasmissione "4 Ristoranti" dove è stato un piacere verificare la preparazione e l'attenzione ai particolari dimostrata dal Titolare.Moderno ma con evidenti richiami alla tradizione, interni particolari ed originali che oltre alla cucina fanno vivere un'esperienza...Focaccia Buona, Carne ottima come ottimo anche il servizio.Il prezzo? Alto ma giusto!
297: Title: Bread and beef at its best.

Review: Oh so glad we went here based on TA reviews and only 80m from the hotel. Great atmosphere in a converted railway arch in a trendy redevelopment. But don't let that fool you this place is seriously good food. We opted for focaccia made on site stuffed with various filling, mine being cheese. The size of a pizza and very thin but with real unique fresh crusty bread taste smothered in cheese. My friends air dried beef was as good while the other friend was reluctant to share his as it was so good!!! We decided to try the speciality of 6 week air dried rib of beef on the bone. The raw meat was brought for our approval before cooking and a slab weighing 1.5kilo looked as unctuous as it tasted after being cooked medium rare. Although it cost £90 to be fair three 14oz steaks would set you back the same if not more in town. No need for serrated steak knives as the meat just fell apart and melted in the mouth. In fact the four sides of chips, parmentier potatoes, sprouting broccoli with orange and crusted fine beans were a mere distraction. The beef was simply the best and most flavoursome I've eaten for about 20 years. We accompanied it with a very nice Primitivo which was so good that we had a second bottle and at only £30 a btl excellent value. Can't comment on desserts as we were too full! The staff are excellent and the maitre d' made the whole experience enjoyable - attentive, knowledgable but not intrusive. Top of my list of places to revisit when next in London.
298: Review: Il quarto della catena aperta a Londra dopo il grande successo del primo. Grande attenzione alla materia prima e molta cura nella presentazione e nell'esaltazione della carne, puntualmente di fassona piemontese che si destreggia alla grande tra tutte le proposte di carne dal mondo di Londra. Un posto molto carino dove passare una serata ad un prezzo onesto e molto conveniente per la costosa Londra.
299:
Review: Me and my family had a great time @ macellaio.
Very good meat, pizza and pasta.
Very nice crew. Pleasent music.
300: Title: Excellent meal and oh wow the fillet steak!

Review: We started here initially for afternoon happy hour cocktails, browsed the menu and decided to return the following evening for dinner. The restaurant is very informal and has a great ambience. This restaurant really does meat superbly well. The fassona (special breed of cattle from Piedmont) is sublime. I am able to buy this from my local Italian deli but it was a pleasure to be able to eat in a restaurant here in London. The fillet was just so succulent, full of flavour ; I went to meat heaven. My husband had the rump with pear and balsamic which was excellent too.There is an extensive wine menu with some interesting (in a good way) selections. No room for pudding. The pissa was bigger than I had expected but delicious. It deserves all the positive reviews. Service friendly. Look forward to returning.
301: Review: Abbiamo pranzato dal Macellaio dopo aver visto la trasmissione di Alessandro Borghese. Tutto ottimo. Abbiamo preso una focaccia di recco alla genovese fatta veramente bene!(possiamo affermarlo visto che l'abbiamo mangiata più volte a Genova) un piatto di ravioli ripieni di ricotta e spinaci conditi con ragù di fassona cotti alla perfezione e un filetto alla griglia che si scioglieva in bocca con contorno di patate. Il tutto annaffiato da un buon chianti. Inoltre all'inizio ci hanno fatto assaggiare un ottima bresaola! Abbiamo speso 96,00 euro circa.Direi che il prezzo è adeguato all'ottima qualità dei prodotti!!Inoltre il personale e' stato veramente gentile e professionale!! Ci torneremo
302: Review: Il locale è molto caratteristico, lo staff cortese ed accogliente. La carne è davvero superlativa...abbiamo mangiato una tagliata che era un burro! Anche il conto devo dire che era in linea con la qualità e non eccessivo. Ci torneremo sicuramente
303: Review: Ero alla ricerca di una steck house vicina all'hotel e tra le proposte di Trip Advisor ho notato il nome di questo locale, che ricordavo anche quale vincitore nella trasmissione 4 ristoranti; sono stato servito da personale cordiale e professionalmente ineccepibile, il menu prevede , come piace a me, 5/6 proposte per portata, accanto alla carne (piemontese) che è ovviamente fondamentale il menu propone anche piatti non comuni all'estero quali: focaccia al formaggio, battuta di carne all'albese etc.. Personalmente ho gustato delle fantastiche tagliatelle con ragù di fassona che consiglio a tutti. Per quanto riguarda i prezzi li considero adeguati alla qualità dei prodotti, sono stato talmente soddisfatto che al momento di pagare ho prenotato anche per la sera successiva che è stata ugualmente soddisfacente; colgo l'occasione per ringraziare Enzo che mi ha servito nelle 2 cene con estrema gentilezza e professionalità,
304: Review: Is this the Best Value Lunch in London?£7 a head. Bottle of Sparkling water, bowl of pasta or a Pisa and a coffee to finish. We took the Micky asked for bread and got bread and Salami and got charged no extra. Small main portion but very nice. Nice staff. Great lunch I can't complain and will go again.
305: Title: Ouch the bill ! Good food.

Review: A party of 5 on a Wednesday for dinner. Macellaio is located near Waterloo train station in one of those little alley where you can find 5 other restaurants/bars. The mood is easy going and eating outdoors is possible. Easily accessible via Southwark tube station, no easy car parking nearby. I would recommend booking in advance to avoid disappointment. Each person had a starter, main course, and dessert. For drinks wine, beer, mineral water. The bill came to a total of £279, with service at 12.5% included. Our waitress was agreeable, discreet and efficient. The starters were of good quality, the main course for all was mainly steak. The steak were cooked as per instructions, but the meat was a bit young and could have been a bit more mature. The desserts were not up to scratch and frankly did not taste good. One Suppe Inglese was by far the weirdest dessert I have ever eaten, and the flavour really surprising but not in a good way. Very sour/bitter. The deep fried milk and chocolate balls at least each 300KCal, and frankly a bit bland. The experience was satisfying but I feel the claim to fame for Macellaio not up to scratch. FYI the people around the table are very frequent global travellers who on average eat out 10-15 times a month.
306: Title: The staff here know how to look after customers - Top Notch service and food

Review: We absolutely loved our two visits to this lovely restaurant. The food was delicious - loved the Ravioli with beef ragu - Above all was the superb service - Just ask for Enzo - he has to be the best waiter in London - The manager cannot do enough for customers - he is anxious that everyone is having a good experience - so far we have sat outside and it has been a treat. If you have a blue Badge just ask for Naomi - she rushed about for cushions for me to be more comfortable - nothing is any trouble here . The whole atmosphere comes from the delightful staff - never intrusive but charming. We sat on red leather settee outside and relaxed there for couple of hours - It's special and a great meal too !.
307: Review: Wij hebben genoten van de heerlijke gerechten en wijnEnorme keus in verschillende Italiaanse wijnen.Zeer gastvrije en vriendelijke bediening.Een aanrader!
308: Review: Siamo capitati in questo ristorante dopo essere stati nell'altra "macelleria" storica 5 o 6 anni fa.Il posto è veramente carino, eravamo in 4 colleghi ed ha colpito molto tutti e 4.Il cibo molto buono, abbiamo fatto un antipasto varione abbondante di affettati e formaggi con pane genovese, seguito da uma costata da 1.5 kg da dividere in 4.Abbiamo scelto 2 vini rossi dalla buona varietà di vini che hanno a disposizione, oltre che a un paio di dolci.Il tutto molto apprezzato, anche la parte scenografica prima dell'apertura del vassoio con la costata ( provare x credere ) .Il conto alla fine è in linea con la vita di Londra.Il personale con noi è stato gentilissimo e disponibile in tutto.Di sicuro, ci rivedremo.
309: Review: My boss and stay in this area on a regular basis as we both work at the local hospitals. Decided to give this place a try on a whim. We ordered house white wine and got served red !White wine when it arrived was of poor quality with a faint vinegar aroma. My bosses chicken was still very pink on the bone, chips were dry as paper, My ravioli had the taste of the tinned stuff i had a s a child . To give the manager his due when we complained he offered to make amends how ever we asked just to pay for the drinks and said we would leave. The manager very graciously said that there was no charge. We left and went to Maria's Tai on lower marsh were your always guaranteed the freshest and most delicious Tia food in London .
310: Review: Non ho l'abitudine di mangiare in ristoranti italiani all'estero ma questa volta ho deciso di accontentare i bimbi che erano in crisi di astinenza da pasta. Devo dire che sono rimasto positivamente sorpreso: pasta al pesto eccezionale, ottima focaccia di Recco e fiorentina di alto livello. Il tutto condito dalla cordialità e gentilezza del personale e da un prezzo equo (200 euro in 7). Ci tornerò...
311: Review: Ottimo ristorante davvero italiano neanche troppo caro per le materie prime utilizzate e per essere a Londra! Ottima carta dei vini (questi cari ma e' normale...). Alla prossima visita ci torneremo sicuramente. Consigliatissimo.
312: Title: Il miglior ristorante italiano di Londra

Review: Sono andato guidato dalla notorietà che la trasmissione di Alessandro Borghese gli ha dato come miglior ristorante italiano di Londra.Sono spesso a Londra e confermo quanto Borghese ha definito.Una deliziosa bruschetta lardo miele e noci, un ottima tartare con gorgonzola e poi una fantastica tagliata di spalla di fassona. Tutto ciò non era nemmeno caro.Il vino ovviamente ha fatto salire un po' il prezzo.Da sottolineare la gentilezza l'attenzione e competenza nel servizio di Enzo
313: Review: Locale molto curato e raffinato, personale disponibile e simpatico, carne di ottima qualità. Tutto perfetto, d'obbligo un pranzo o una cena se si passa per Londra
314: Review: Posto di qualità, curato nei dettagli e molto piacevole,personale disponibile, simpatico ed educato la qualità del cibo non si discute.. ma il rapporto costo / quantità non è adeguato !!! Non si parla della carne, del vino (la scelta è ben definita e descritta) ma il costo dei contorni , entrè eccetera ..è molto alto per l offerta ed in particolare le porzioni sono poco adeguate (esigua quantità) .. si può uscire avendo pagato molto .. ma con ancora un pó di fame!!!!
315: Review: Sono andato a cena nel ristorante di Union Street per il mio compleanno. Il locale è molto bello e colpisce subito. Calorosa l'accoglienza. Ci siamo accomodati al nostro tavolo (che pur essendo vicino alla porta non subiva spifferi di alcun tipo) e, poco dopo, il cameriere, ci ha portato il menù particolarissimo (fatto come se fosse un giornale). Ci siamo affidati a lui chiedendo consiglio su quali fossero i piatti migliori. Notando la competenza del cameriere ci siamo fidati (e abbiamo fatto benissimo). Abbiamo iniziato con qualche fetta di salame di fassona (davvero squisita). Abbiamo poi continuato con una focaccia ripiena di stracchino saporita e delicata allo stesso tempo (io e mia moglie la consigliamo davvero).
